result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin S. Matichek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin S. Matichek is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin S. Matichek was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician. Defendant is to have no contact with the victim and anyone under age 18. any contact with individuals under age 18 to be supervised and approved by agent. Defendant to undergo sex offender assessment and follow up with any recommended treatment. Defendant is to comply with sex offender registry. Any significant relationship is subject to agent approval. Defendant is to have no access to any internet capable device without agent approval. Defendant is not to have access to social media without agent approval.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.
Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos.    No Contact with C.N.R. dob: 6/16/99;  No Contact with children.  No access to computers or the internet.
